Detailed Description

The section has a list of all the exported API which the applications need to invoke in order to use the driver.

Function Documentation

uint32_t DMA_assignChannel ( DMA_Handle  handle,
uint32_t  channel,
uint32_t  reqline,
int32_t *  errCode 
)

Function to assign DMA request lines to channels. This should be used only if the channel is meant for H/W triggering. For S/W triggered channel, ignore this API.

Precondition
DMA_open() has been called.
Parameters
handleA DMA_Handle returned from DMA_open()
channelDMA channel. This can be a specific channel
reqlineDMA request line
errCode[out] valid errorCode if NULL handle returned.
Returns
The channel number upon success. 'DMA_CHANNEL_NONE' if an error occurs.
See also
DMA_open()
int32_t DMA_clearChannelInterruptFlag ( DMA_Handle  handle,
uint32_t  channel,
DMA_IntType  intType 
)

Function to clear the DMA channel completion status based on interrupt type. This API should be called before triggering the channel and using DMA_getChannelInterruptFlag() for polling.

Precondition
DMA_open() has been called and DMA_enableInterrupt() has not been called for this channel/request type.
Parameters
handleA DMA_Handle returned from DMA_open()
channelDMA channel.
intTypeDMA interrupt type
Returns
valid errorCode.
See also
DMA_open()
int32_t DMA_close ( DMA_Handle  handle)

Function to close a DMA peripheral specified by the DMA handle.

Precondition
DMA_open() has been called.
Parameters
handleA DMA_Handle returned from DMA_open()
Returns
0 upon success. error code if an error occurs.
See also
DMA_open()

uint32_t  channel,

)

DMA_open() has been called.

triggerTypeDMA channel trigger type

uint32_t  channel,

)

int32_t DMA_enableInterrupt ( DMA_Handle  handle,
uint32_t  channel,
DMA_IntType  intType,
DMA_IntHandlerFuncPTR  callbackFn,
void *  callbackArg 
)

Function to enable a given interrupt type for a given channel.

Precondition
DMA_open() has been called.
Parameters
handleA DMA_Handle returned from DMA_open()
channelDMA channel.
intTypeDMA interrupt type
callbackFnUser supplied callback function that the ISR will call on receiving this interrupt. Care should be taken by the user to do minimal processing in this callback function. Typical implementation of this function would do some kind of semaphore or event post.
callbackArgUser supplied callback functions arg that will be provided back to user when the callback function is called from the ISR.
Returns
0 upon success. error code if an error occurs.
See also
DMA_open()
int32_t DMA_freeChannel ( DMA_Handle  handle,
uint32_t  channel,
uint32_t  reqline 
)

Function to remove the DMA request lines to channel mapping and free the channel for another assignment.

Precondition
DMA_assignChannel() has been called.
Parameters
handleA DMA_Handle returned from DMA_open()
channelDMA channel.
reqlineDMA request line
Returns
0 upon success. error code if an error occurs.
See also
DMA_open()
uint32_t DMA_getChannelInterruptFlag ( DMA_Handle  handle,
uint32_t  channel,
DMA_IntType  intType,
int32_t *  errCode 
)

Function to get the DMA channel completion status based on interrupt type. This API can be used for polling channel transfer completion when interrupts are not enabled for that channel by using FTC or BTC as the intType.

Precondition
DMA_open() has been called and DMA_enableInterrupt() has not been called for this channel/request type.
Parameters
handleA DMA_Handle returned from DMA_open()
channelDMA channel.
intTypeDMA interrupt type
errCode[out] valid errorCode.
Returns
1-if the channel's corresponding intType flag is set. 0-if the channel's corresponding intType flag is not set.
See also
DMA_open()
int32_t DMA_getChannelStatus ( DMA_Handle  handle,
uint32_t  channel,
DMA_ChannelStatus *  pChanStatus 
)

Function to get the channel status.

Precondition
DMA_open() has been called.
Parameters
handleA DMA_Handle returned from DMA_open()
channelDMA channel.
pChanStatus[out] Output block filled by the driver with the channel status
See also
DMA_open()
int32_t DMA_getStatus ( DMA_Handle  handle,
uint32_t  channel,
DMA_Status *  pDmaStatus 
)

Function to get the DMA peripheral status.

Precondition
DMA_open() has been called.
Parameters
handleA DMA_Handle returned from DMA_open()
channelDMA channel.
pDmaStatus[out] Output block filled by the driver with the peripheral status
See also
DMA_open()
void DMA_init ( void  )

Function to initialize the DMA module.

Precondition
This function must be called once per system and before any other DMA driver APIs. It resets all the DMA H/W instances in the system.
DMA_Handle DMA_open ( uint32_t  index,
DMA_Params *  params,
int32_t *  errCode 
)

Function to initialize a given DMA peripheral instance.

Function to initialize a given DMA peripheral instance specified by the particular index value. Only the first call to this function initializes the peripheral - subsequent calls just return the already initialized handle.

Precondition
DMA_init() has been called
Parameters
indexDMA instance number
paramsDMA params for creating a instance for the first time. This structure can be pre-populated with default values using DMA_Params_init() API. This will be used in the first DMA_open() call; it will be ignored for subsequent open calls.
errCode[out] valid errorCode if NULL handle returned.
Returns
A DMA_Handle upon success. NULL if an error occurs.
See also
DMA_init()
DMA_close()
void DMA_Params_init ( DMA_Params *  params)

Function to initialize the DMA params strcuture needed for DMA_open() call.

Parameters
paramsDMA params for creating a instance for the first time
Returns
nothing
See also
DMA_open()

)

ctrlPacketDMA Control Packet Parameters
Returns
